title: Letters and memorials of Jane Welsh Carlyle.
author: Carlyle, Jane Welsh
snippet: 'Moffat House,' where brother John was now established with his wife, is the Raehills' (Hope Johnstone) town house; a big, old- fashioned, red ashlar edifice, stands gaunt and high in the central part of Moffat; which the Hope Johnstones now never u*e, and which, some time ago, brother John had rented as a dwelling-place, handy for Scotsbng, &c, being one of various advantages.
